alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 21 at 6:22AM AKST until January 22 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to 6 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dropping temperatures combined with increasing winds today will produce wind chill values to 50 below by this afternoon and tonight.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
